title: CWG 2022 Day 10 blog: Sharath-Sreeja win TT gold, three gold in boxing, historic triple jump 1-2
content:
Key updates of Indian athletes from Day 10:15 medals added to the tally (Total: 55)Boxing: THREE GOLD MEDALS!¬†Nitu Ghanghas, Amit Panghal and Nikhat Zareen get to the top of the podium with dominant wins. Sagar finished with SILVER in the +92kg.¬†Hockey: BRONZE!¬†Indian women edge out New Zealand after a thrilling shootout in the¬† bronze medal match for a famous win. Savita Punia the hero once again.Athletics:¬†GOLD-SILVER!¬†A famous 1-2 for India in the men‚Äôs triple jump for Eldhose & Abdulla. In men.¬†BRONZE¬†in men‚Äôs 10,000m race walk for Sandeep Kumar & women‚Äôs javelin for Annu Rani.Table tennis: GOLD!¬†Sreeja-Sharath win India‚Äôs first mixed doubles TT gold medal in CWG history. The pair of national champion had a a campaign to remember, with Sreeja bouncing back from a singles heatbreak.¬†Table tennis: SILVER!¬†Sathiyan-Sharath battle hard against defending champs from England, but go down in five games.Cricket T20: SILVER! Harmanpreet Kaur did her best but it was another final heartbreak for India.¬†Badminton: BRONZE MEDALS!¬†Srikanth, Treesa-Gayatri bounce back after semifinal defeats.Squash: BRONZE!¬†Dipika Pallikal Karthik and Saurav Ghosal claim bronze in the mixed doubles.Badminton:¬†PV Sindhu battles through women‚Äôs singles final despite struggling with her movement. Lakshya Sen also into the final, needing three games. Satwik-Chirag cruise through to final as well.

    We are proud of you #TeamIndia üíô pic.twitter.com/ri7VWsSxHp‚Äî BCCI Women (@BCCIWomen) August 7, 2022



        
    
        
    
        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    Cricket T20: Glad Harmanpreet Kaur acknowledged the problem without mincing her words in the Sony Sports interview. The silver must be applauded but that was another final that India lost from a winning position. 
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    Harmanpreet Kaur knows where the issues lies, and is determined to rectify it #CWG22 #B2022 pic.twitter.com/5dmSbCae03‚Äî ESPNcricinfo (@ESPNcricinfo) August 7, 2022



        
    
        
    
        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    CWG 2022, Squash: Dipika Pallikal Karthik and Saurav Ghosal clinch mixed doubles bronze
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    #CWG2022 #B2022 #TableTennis India's first ever CWG mixed doubles gold medal üèìü•á @sharathkamal1 & #SreejaAkula with a campaign to remember. https://t.co/1sYNMn3neg pic.twitter.com/WzGxT7nlPb‚Äî The Field (@thefield_in) August 7, 2022



        
    
        
    
        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    CWG 2022, Boxing: Nikhat Zareen, Nitu Ghanghas, Amit Panghal clinch gold with dominant performances
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
        
    
        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    Boxing: Indian boxers finish with three gold medals, one silver and three bronze medals. 
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    Silver medal for Sagar after yet another brutal boxing bout. England‚Äôs Delicious Orie, riding on massive home support, clinches gold.#CWG2022 pic.twitter.com/9wKVWUowxs‚Äî Aditya Chaturvedi (@aditya_c19) August 7, 2022



        
    
        
    
        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    Athletics Men‚Äôs Javelin Final: DP Manu and Rohit Yadav finish fifth and sixth in the final. Manu‚Äôs best was an 82.28m while Rohit threw a best of 82.22m. The night belonged to Arshad Nadeem of Pakistan. What a final for him!
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    #CWG2022 #B2022 #JavelinThrow Aug 7, 2021: Neeraj Chopra wins Olympic Games gold.Aug 7, 2022: Arshad Nadeem wins CWG gold. 90.18! Whattey. That was a brilliant javelin final.https://t.co/aZsTFSephF pic.twitter.com/sdXk8DYifg‚Äî Vinayakk (@vinayakkm) August 7, 2022



        
    
        
    
        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    Men‚Äôs +92kg (Super Heavyweight) Final Sagar vs Delicious ORIE: Sagar lands a nasty cut on his face. It‚Äôs a bloody bout and the English crowd loves it. Orie adds to the misery with a flurry of brutal punches. In the end Orie wins the bou twith a 5:0 UD. Sagar wins silver medal! He really had a fine campaign but faced a tough ask in the final against a good boxer in front of home crowd.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    

        
    
        
    
        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    Men‚Äôs +92kg (Super Heavyweight) Final Sagar vs Delicious ORIE: What bout this is. 44 seconds to go and Sagar needs medical attention with blood on his face.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
        
    
        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    Men‚Äôs +92kg (Super Heavyweight) Final Sagar vs Delicious ORIE: OH WOW! It‚Äôs a 10-9 for Orie across the board and we are tied. 19-19-19-19-19. Samreen on R1: Sagar is being advised by coach Rana not to hook so often. It‚Äôs been a fight between equals so far but Sagar comes out with the advantage. The commentators are surprised but he takes the first round on all five cards.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
        
    
        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    Men‚Äôs +92kg (Super Heavyweight) Final Sagar vs Delicious ORIE: The first round to the Indian across the board.Meanwhile in javelin. 
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    Anderson Peters just timepassed for the entire competition and threw a monster 88.64 at the end to take the lead with his 5th attempt. And then Arshad Nadeem comes in and throws 90.18!!! GAMES RECORD, PB! Peters gives him a big hug. What an effort by the Pakistani. #CWG2022 pic.twitter.com/qwORxHFRHP‚Äî Vinayakk (@vinayakkm) August 7, 2022



        
    
        
    
        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    Boxing: Showman Sagar time!
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
        
    
        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    Athletics Men‚Äôs Javelin Final: DP Manu and Rohit Yadav stay fifth and sixth after their fourth throws. There‚Äôs still hope for an Indian medal here. Manu, who has thrown 82.28m, is just 0.46m behind third-placed Anderson Peters. Rohit has struggled though. 
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    

        
    
        
    
        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    Athletics: Men‚Äôs 4x400m relay ‚Äì India finish 6th. 
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    

    #CWG2022 #B2022 #TableTennis It's a second ü•á for India in the sport at this Games, and a first EVER in mixed doubles. And who else but @sharathkamal1 to breach that landmark, partnered by with Sreeja Akula who was just as impressive in the final against Malaysia. pic.twitter.com/fsp5L5za4w‚Äî The Field (@thefield_in) August 7, 2022



    Arshad Nadeem definitely believes he can yell his javelin further.We agree with this strategy. It is science.#B2022‚Äî Change of Pace (@ChangeofPace414) August 7, 2022



        
    
        
    
        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    Badminton women‚Äôs doubles bronze medal match: Oh, that‚Äôs a well deserved bronze medal for the Indian teenagers! Treesa Jolly and Gayatri Gopichand were tested quite a bit in the second game. But a fabulous, professional performance from the youngsters as they win in straight games. Medal on debut for the two 19-year-olds.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    

        
    
        
    
        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    Athletics: Men‚Äôs 4x400m relay time. 
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    

        
    
        
    
        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    Boxing update from Samreen: The final Indian aiming his shot at gold, Showman Sagar will now take on England‚Äôs Delicious Orie in the men‚Äôs +92kg final.  The Indian‚Äôs advantage has been his speed, something his opponents have been lacking. Can that work today too?
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
        
    
        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    Athletics Men‚Äôs Javelin Final: After three throws, India‚Äôs DP Manu and Rohit Yadav are fifth and sixth with best throws of 82.28m and 80.66m respectively. Arshad Nadeem leads with his 88m throw. Peters back in the medal mix. Still well off his best but don‚Äôt count out one big throw from him. Both Indians have made the cut for top eight, so that‚Äôs one thing checked off. 
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    

        
    
        
    
        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    Table Tennis Mixed doubles final: A Sharath Kamal/Sreeja Akula 3-1 Javen Choong/Karen Lyne: AND IT‚ÄôS GOLD MEDAL FOR INDIA! The pair of national champions from earlier this year beat Malaysia 11-4, 9-11, 11-5, 11-6. This has been a journey of wonderful emotions for the man who has won it all and the woman who is starting out to impress. India‚Äôs most prolific male national winner and India‚Äôs most recent female national paddler. 
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
        
    
        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    Table Tennis Mixed doubles final: A Sharath Kamal/Sreeja Akula 1-1 Javen Choong/Karen Lyne: Strong response from the Indians, take the third 11-5 to go 2-1 up. The Indians need just one more game for the gold.Athletics, men‚Äôs javelin final: What a final Arshad Nadeem is having! Another PB! 
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    

        
    
        
    
        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    Table Tennis Mixed doubles final: A Sharath Kamal/Sreeja Akula 1-1 Javen Choong/Karen Lyne: The Malaysians level it up, win the second 11-9Badminton women‚Äôs doubles bronze medal match: Treesa and Gayatri take the first game 21-15. The teenagers are a game away from the podium! The Aussie pair are not a regular pairing on tour bit Somerville is a fighter and Chen is a solid singles player. But the Indians are handling this professionally.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    India‚Äôs decision to play such few specialist batters cost them eventually. Needed 23 off 16 with 5 wickets in hand, should have won from there. Nonetheless, a silver medal to be proud of.#CWG2022 #INDvAUS pic.twitter.com/hLUl4OGe1T‚Äî Aditya Chaturvedi (@aditya_c19) August 7, 2022



        
    
        
    
        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    Cricket T20, IND vs AUS Final: Australia win by 9 runs! They make history by becoming the first ever CWG gold medallists in women‚Äôs T20 cricket. INDIA WILL TAKE HOME SILVER! IND: 152 (19.3)If there is a new major event for the women‚Äôs game, it is only fitting that it is won by Meg Lanning‚Äôs Australia. Winning machine.   The first CWG T20 cricket gold goes to this golden generation of cricketers.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    #CWG2022 #B2022 #CricketT20  Don't say anything about the batting lineup Don't say anything about the batting lineupDon't say anything about the batting lineup Don't say anything about the batting lineuphttps://t.co/aZsTFSephF pic.twitter.com/fSMZuP5f5J‚Äî Vinayakk (@vinayakkm) August 7, 2022



        
    
        
    
        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    Cricket T20, IND vs AUS Final: JJ to Yastika Bhatia. First ball, she denies single. Next ball, she gets back for two but there is a run out at the other end. She is not the greatest between the wickets but has strike, 10 off 4 balls. And one wicket left. India 152/9. 
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
        
    
        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    Cricket T20, IND vs AUS Final: Like dominoes... Deepti Sharma, after hitting a four, is LBW by Schutt.  India need 11 off the last over. JJ to do it. Yastika Bhatia, concussion sub is in. Proper batter alright but is it too much for her too late? Table Tennis Mixed doubles final, A Sharath Kamal/Sreeja Akula vs Javen Choong/Kare Lyne: Pretty steady, positive and aggressive from the Indians, taking the first game 11-4
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
        
    
        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    Athletics, men‚Äôs javelin final: Here‚Äôs how things look after first attempts. Peters, the world champion, with a below par throw to start. Table Tennis Mixed doubles final, A Sharath Kamal/Sreeja Akula vs Javen Choong/Karen Lyne It‚Äôs India up against Malaysia in this mixed doubles gold medal match. Karen has been a thorn in the flesh for India. 
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    

        
    
        
    
        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    Cricket T20, IND vs AUS Final: Rana is runout. Things have gone wrong for India in the last few overs of the chase while Australia have only risen in intensity.   India need 17 off 12, and a miracle.  IND: 145/6 (18) Target: 162
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    #CWG2022 #B2022#Athletics Men's Javelin Final DP Manu and Rohit Yadav have gone past the 80m mark with their first couple of throws. Arshad Nadeem is the leader with a PB of 86.81m. World Champion Anderson Peters is fourth with 82.30mUpdates: https://t.co/pH5Asn73Fb pic.twitter.com/AhZPlGhe7S‚Äî The Field (@thefield_in) August 7, 2022



        
    
        
    
        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    Cricket T20, IND vs AUS Final: It‚Äôs all falling apart for India. Vastrakar first departs, Harmanpreet also miscues a scoop. Gardner with a potentially match winning over. IND: 121/5 (15.5) Target: 162
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    A special knock from a special player. Harmanpreet Kaur üôåüèΩ#CWG2022 #INDvAUS pic.twitter.com/oJJ0NhDyzr‚Äî Aditya Chaturvedi (@aditya_c19) August 7, 2022



    

    

        
    
        
    
        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    Cricket T20, IND vs AUS Final: Schutt breaks the 96-run partnership! Jemimah was struggling and it was made worse by the wrist injury. Make or break moment for India here.  They need 44 off 30 balls.   IND: 118/3 (14.3) Target: 162 Badminton men‚Äôs singles bronze medal match: Srikanth Kidambi wins the bronze medal!  A straight-games win for him against Singapore‚Äôs Jason Teh who was struggling big-time with an injury to his leg.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    Bronze medal for Srikanth Kidambi as he defeats Singapore‚Äôs Jason Teh, who was in incredible pain due to a leg injury. Srikanth had to do it the hard way but a well-deserved spot on the podium for him.#CWG2022 #Badminton pic.twitter.com/2siljbPHVd‚Äî Aditya Chaturvedi (@aditya_c19) August 7, 2022



        
    
        
    
        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    Cricket T20, IND vs AUS Final: FIFTY for Harmanpreet Kaur! The captain‚Äôs on the charge and knows she must bat through to take her team home.  IND: 94/2 (12.1) Target: 162 
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    #CWG2022 Captain Harmanpreet leading from the front. ‚úÖhttps://t.co/EObuedYSC4 pic.twitter.com/pjLFnV4Kg1‚Äî Samreen (@SamreenRazz) August 7, 2022



    HARMANPREET üî•üî•üî•‚Äî Rohit Sankar (@imRohit_SN) August 7, 2022



    A half-century of rich quality from Harmanpreet Kaur. She‚Äôs manipulated the fielder masterfully with the scoops and aerial strokes on either side. A proper captain‚Äôs knock after India lost big wickets early.#CWG2022 #INDvAUS pic.twitter.com/2aXzoZEkjH‚Äî Aditya Chaturvedi (@aditya_c19) August 7, 2022



        
    
        
    
        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    Badminton bronze medal match, Srikanth Kidambi 1-0 Jason Teh: ‚ÄúHow on earth is he doing this?‚Äù The commentator is amazed that Teh continuing to pull points off while struggling with cramp evidently. After every rally he is struggling. Trailing 15-18 and a game. 
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
        
    
        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    Badminton bronze medal match, Srikanth Kidambi 1-0 Jason Teh: The SGP shuttler is physically struggling almost every point bit is still pulling off good points. The Indian leads 18-13, is 3 points away from a bronze.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    Crowd seriously into this contest! #AUSvIND #B2022 pic.twitter.com/3MKvat0JJz‚Äî Laura Jolly (@JollyLauz18) August 7, 2022



        
    
        
    
        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    Cricket T20, IND vs AUS Final: 82 required off 54 balls. And then another good over for India. Two fours for Kaur. Make it 69 off 48 balls. Not impossible... but India need Kaur. Plenty more from Kaur. UPDATE FROM BCCI: - Wicket-keeper Yastika Bhatia is the concussion substitute for Taniyaa Bhatia, who was hit on the back of her head while keeping wickets during India‚Äôs bowling in the first innings.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    Harmanpreet Kaur bat-swing blessing Edgbaston.#CWG2022 #INDvAUS pic.twitter.com/O1hg404zto‚Äî Aditya Chaturvedi (@aditya_c19) August 7, 2022



        
    
        
    
        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    Badminton bronze medal match, Srikanth Kidambi 1-0 Jason Teh: Teh is not 100% but he is fighting back. Srikanth is still controlling most rallies. 11-7 for the Indian.Cricket T20, IND vs AUS Final:  Three boundaries off one Brown over and it gave some momentum back. Harmanpreet and Jemimah have their tasks cut out but are steadying things for India. It‚Äôs up to these two last ‚Äòproper batters‚Äô to build a match-winning partnership.  IND: 73/2 (10) Target: 162 
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    Kidambi please. pic.twitter.com/6GJZj6xckt‚Äî Vipul (@Sporty_Baba) August 7, 2022



        
    
        
    
        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    Table Tennis Men‚Äôs singles SF: G Sathiyan 1-4 Liam Pitchford: World No 20 prevails. Pitchford gets the job done. Goes through to the final with a 11-5, 4-11, 11-8, 11-9, 11-9 win. He‚Äôll face Achanta Sharath Kamal in the final, Sathiyan will take on Drinkhall for bronze.

    Badminton bronze medal match, Srikanth Kidambi 1-0 Jason Teh: That‚Äôs a mix of sublime and frustrating from Srikanth but more former than the latter. Jason Teh showing crazy defence in a couple of points but not enough for the youngster. Srikanth *should* close this out.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    

        
    
        
    
        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    Table Tennis Men‚Äôs singles SF: G Sathiyan 1-3 Liam Pitchford: Sathiyan staring at defeat. Pitchford just one game away now. Takes the fourth 11-9, does the world No 20 from England. 
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
        
    
        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    Cricket T20, IND vs AUS Final: Not to be for Smriti today and. Shafali follows her right after, off Gardner. McGrath takes the catch but they can‚Äôt celebrate because she‚Äôs Covid positive. Shafali was just dropped in the over. Bizarre cricket by India who have a short batting lineup. IND: 22/2 (2.4) Target: 162 
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
        
    
        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    Badminton bronze medal match, Srikanth Kidambi vs Jason Teh: Early signs that Jason Teh is not going to make this easy for Srikanth, some gruelling rallies already. And both men must be tired in their bones. A 11-10 lead for Sri at the interval. 
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
        
    
        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    TableTennis Men‚Äôs singles SF: G Sathiyan 1-2 Liam Pitchford: The World No 20 is pumped up. Pitchford takes the lead again, wins the third game 11-8.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
        
    
        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    Cricket T20, IND vs AUS Final:  BIG WICKET! Over 1.5: Smriti Mandhana 6(7) is bowled by Darcie Brown, India 16/1, What a strange decision by Smriti to play a shot behind the wicket against Brown. The pacer just kept it straight and is bowled. So many shots in her repertoire and now twice she is out playing a strange one down the leg side.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
        
    
        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    Table Tennis Men‚Äôs singles SF: G Sathiyan 1-1 Liam Pitchford: Sathiyan levels the match, winning 11-4. This, by the way, is the first singles meeting between the two as per ITTF database. 
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
        
    
        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    Badminton bronze medal match, Srikanth Kidambi vs Jason Teh: Can Srikanth recover from the disappointment from earlier today? First meeting with Jason Teh, world No 87.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    

        
    
        
    
        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    MEDAL ALERT!  Dipika Pallikal Karthik and Saurav Ghosal claim bronze in the mixed doubles squash!
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

    #CWG2022 #B2022 #TableTennis Like the words say in the background... it's almost as if @sharathkamal1 is "just beginning" Back in the men's singles final of the Commonwealth Games after Melbourne 2006! ‚è≥https://t.co/BboJbzcdob pic.twitter.com/z7IJ4Nzp6P‚Äî The Field (@thefield_in) August 7, 2022



        
    
        
    
        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    Cricket T20, IND vs AUS Final: Innings break ‚Äì Australia finish with 161/8. A good fightback in the death overs by India. Their fielding was brilliant today with Radha Yadav and Deepti Sharma leading the way. Renuka Singh Thakur and Sneh Rana took two wickets apiece, while Beth Mooney top-scored for Australia with 61 off 41.
    
        
        
            
            
            
        
    

        
    
        
    
        
    
    
       
       
       
    
    
    
    
    Squash, mixed doubles bronze ‚Äì Ghosal/Pallikal 2-0 Pilley/Lobban: Dipika Pallikal Karthik and Saurav Ghosal win the mixed doubles bronze! A dominant performance from the Indian pair to secure a 11-8, 11-4 win over Gold Coast champions Pilley and Lobban.
